review:
Puddle is perfect in almost every sense. It's a not that typical indie game, it's challenging, have a fast pace, it's finally a real fun! This is a sole indie title I played till the credits since a long time.
In this game, as you can see in the trailer, you control the liquid. The only method of control is to tilt a world a little. Basically the tilt creates a height difference between the liquid and the ground and the former accelerates due to gravity. You can use a keyboard arrow keys, but I personally recommend a gamepad triggers. So, you use just two keys to progress through the whole game.
The game's world is divided to several chapters, which consists of number of levels. Each chapter represent a visually and aesthetically differing surround and the type of liquid you control in it. In some chapters you have different types of liquid in different levels. You starting at Watercourse with a coffee, proceeding as a water, then going to the Nursery transforming into weed killer (Sodium chlorate + copper oxide), become a fertilizer, travelling to the Laboratory, where the liquid turns into a hydrocarbon, oil, nytroglycerine, fruit juice + technecium solution... Human Body, Sewers, Rocket, Foundry, Nuclear Power Station at last! Each type of liquid has it's unique properties, water freezes and evaporates, nytroglycerine explodes when handled without a care and lava hardens when it's far from the heat source. The gravity in zero-gravity zone is actually zero, but in the centrifuge at the nuclear station with tremendous radiation levels the gravity alters after short distance travelled. You need to adapt you reflexes and to reinvent controls patterns with almost every new world's and liquid's conditions introduced in the game. And that's really fun.
For me, the most funny part was a human body chapter. It starts like a real anatomically true human body but quickly you realize, that this 'body' has nothing to do with it's real world representation. The game's 'human body' is abstract as hell. As a chapter climax, your liquid get absorbed into the circulatory system, the view gets zoomed to 500x and you find youself in a blood cappilary system. You barely can control such a microscopic amounts of substances by tilting the world, so your gamepad's triggers, being rhythmically pushed one after another, pumps the blood and your precious solution of juice and technecium, which some fool drank, will jerkily flow through the capillaries. The fun is massive.
Seems like game developers had a lot of ideas and that's great they realised a good part of it. THe game doesn't just exploiting the idea and brilliant representation of realistically looking liquid physics model through the whole game, which will be a tempting approach for some indie game studios. But no, they developing and evolving the original idea level after level, adapting and transforming it. And you just keep getting amazed when new properties and world conditions get introduced.
At some levels the game is really challenging. Some levels can be passed only after 30 tries or so. Some levels' obvious difficulty can leave you infuriated and with no progress. And this is undoubtedly true for the very final level. There are no chances you can beat it in one sitting.
This game is great. Small graphical inconsistencies here and there, like non-working antialiasing on 1440p cannot make it not great. The whole idea and implemention are great. If you're into indie gaming and your library is not like CoD 15 and BF 5 likes all the way up and down you should probably check it out. And I presume you'll not be dissatisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981896021', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1397992103}
review:
*Edited the review since the major bugs and crashes have been fixed. However, I still do not recommend this game, as it is not really FUN. This however, is according to my personal taste, so I will elaborate further.

=================================================================

This game seems at first to remind me of fun titles such as World of Goo, Nightsky, and other physics based platformers with objects to control.

(-) However, its more frustrating, as the liquid is not as controllable as you'd expect. Most times, it is quite random how much liquid you'd lose along the way, so getting a gold medal depends more on luck (and trying a million times) rather than having perfect control of the "physics".

(-) The game has options to assign different "left" and "right" for the liquid and for the environment, but this simply doesn't work. It makes the game unplayable. Not sure why they have these settings when all you need are 2 keys to play the game.

(+) This I suppose makes it a pro for keyboard players, since you don't need an XBOX controller to play this game, like many steam games nowadays.

(+) Another good point is that there is a lot of variety. You will "handle" different liquids in different environments. The artistic value is there, and it does show that the developers tried with this game.

(-) The variety however is pretty much summed up in the two lines above. You will not have to use your brain or solve puzzles to progress. You simply follow the linear path, trying to avoid obstacles or things that will reduce the amount of liquid you have. You WILL lose liquid. The point is trying to get to the end with enough to progress to the next level.

Unfortunately, this game simply isn't as fun as the games mentioned above.
I have played many games. Some pull you in. Some repel you. This game does neither. For this I am still inclined to open it up and play it to the end, but at the same time I'm not really having as fun as I do with games that do pull me in.

There isn't a challenge per se. You go from A to B without any chance to deviate from the path.

I still open this game up from time to time, as I like to complete my games. But this one is taking a while since I don't have fun when I do. It's not a BAD game though, but it's not one that I can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982519369', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1394601758}
review:
Interesting game. I've already finished nearly half of the levels in a little over two hours (and I am sure some of that was time away from my computer or watching something momentarially-as lately I have been watching YouTube in the background.
I say 'finished' half of the levels because some, if not many of them I didn't even rank in. I have more copper than silver and more 'check marks' (i.e. finished, but did not rank) than gold (and likely silver).
But the poor 'what exactly do I need to do to rank copper, silver or gold, isn't really the problem... anyone can figure that out after playing a level a few times... no, the problem I found is that in the labratory levels, specifically playing Nitroglycerin, if you start the second level of without directly beating the prior-and even then sometimes-your will immediately explode, restart the level and repeat. Even that can be a simple error in coding, not spawning the liquid correctly, or the game assuming the liquid is moving too quickly as it 'jumps' into existance... but when you get to the Body levels, and specifically the blood levels I constantly get a divide by zero warning. This doesn't crash the game, but it does freeze it until I 'windows key' out and click 'ok'.
I haven't gotten past these levels yet, as I fet it inportant to add this to a review. If you are programming anything you really NEED to make sure you don't have code divide by zero. Usually it will completely crash software (ah, the blue screens of old), and I'm not entirely sure how this software is able to cope with it.
The game looks finished and even polished, until you reach the bugs that clearly show it is not. It is still fun to play, and for those who feel the need to get gold on everything you'll have a challenge... but they really needed to go over their software and make sure things worked correctly, each time, for all hardware.
(A FYI, I'm on an HP Pavillion 7000, with Intel I7 and nVidia GeForce 630M, running WIndows 7--so it isn't like I'm trying to run the game on obscure hardware or software).

EDIT: So, I've had to 'skip' some levels... Space is hard, and the level just before also has the divide by zero error...

review: A fun physics game that got difficult towards the end.  I used a controller, and there are really only 2 buttons for this game.  You can tilt the screen left or right to make your liquid move.  The liquids vary from level to level, which keeps things interesting.  For example, water evaporates if you get it close to heat, while nitroglycerine explodes.  And each new liquid's unique traits come into play in the levels.  You can skip levels if you get frustrated, but you have a finite number of skips (that you can earn back if you do eventually beat a level you skipped).  I had fun, but eventually quit without beating it, as it doesn't have a checkpoint system and I got frustrated by later levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031272970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1406554188}
review:
Puddle est une bizarerie sans nom qui mèle de près ou de loin le jeu d'adresse et de plateforme.

Deux touches seront nécessaire pour progresser. Tourner l'écran vers la droite, et tourner l'écran vers la gauche. Ce faisant vous ferez couler votre liquide vers la gauche ou la droite pour atteindre la fin du niveau.

Cela peut paraître simple dit comme cela, mais Puddle est loin d'être facile. De nombreux pièges, ainsi que différents liquides (avec pour chacuns: des propriétés différentes) se combinent à l'ingéniosité des niveaux qui vous obligera parfois à vous poser et réfléchir (ou tâtonner) pour venir à bout du parcour.

Ce jeu peut ne pas plaire à tout le monde de par son concept vraiment étrange, mais si vous aimez les expériences qui sortent du commun, Puddle est clairement fait pour vous.


L'affreux

author: {'steamid': '76561197980940812', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1361692800}
review:
[b]Персональный рейтинг - 6,5 из 10[/b]

Если в школе вы прогуливали уроки по физике, как я, например, то платформер Puddle призван прийти вам на помощь. Хотя, что я несу... у нас в школе и опытов-то таких не было. В основном одни скучные формулы, закон Ома, бином Ньютона и прочее-прочее. Собственно, поэтому и прогуливал, что челюсти сводило от постоянной зевоты. Впрочем, давайте "грехов моих разбор оставим до поры" и посмотрим, что из себя представляет игра.

А игра представляет из себя довольно любопытный платформер с физически моделируемым поведением жидкостей. Отсюда и название - Puddle (буквально, "лужа, грязь"). Набор текучих субстанций разнообразен: тут вам и кофе, и нитроглицерин, и кипящий металл и даже урина. Задача - провести определенное количество жидкости от старта уровня до финиша, минуя всевозможные препятствия и решая простенькие задачки. Каждая субстанция обладает своими свойствами и управление за каждую из них отличается от предыдущей. К примеру, нитроглицерином управлять нужно крайне осторожно, иначе при сильном столкновении произойдет взрыв и придется начинать сначала. Стоит ли говорить, что в процессе прохождения жидкость может вылиться за край и с нас вычтут очки рейтинга, благо последние начисляются за общий объем субстанции "пришедшей" к финишу. Чем больше донесли - тем больше очков. 

Уровни очень разнообразны да и сделаны с фантазией. Тут лучше один раз увидеть, как говорится... Ну или взглянуть на скриншоты, кому как нравится. 

Не берусь утверждать, что понравится всем и каждому, но любителям всего необычного попробовать стоит.

review:
Puddle is a game I have enjoyed over several months. It's probably not a game I would recommend playing straight through, but to fire up from time to time and finish a few levels, I think it's good fun and worth it to have. I say this because depending on who you are it could be frustrating to finish certain levels or achievements. To me this is a good thing, as it adds playtime and I always feel accomplished when I finish a level that was difficult for me. 

Some people may not like it, but I laughed a good bit over the "whine" button and the message you get when you're choosing the difficulty. So much so that I shared this with friends who don't own the game. Hilarious, and I thank the devs for including those gems!

Even on my toaster for a PC the game looks beautiful, and runs fairly well. If you're a patient person, who doesn't get butthurt over jokes and like arcade-type games, I think Puddle is definitely worth having in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994641567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1387686658}
review:
Such a disgustingly terribly game.

The scoring system is bad.  You don't know what you're being scored on until you finish each run.  On some runs you need to conserve fluid, on others you need to be as fast as possible.  Unfortunately, there is literally no way of telling which level is which type until you've reached the end.

Further, the game is heavily trial and error.  There are many curves and jumps that you need to be going a certain speed over to clear them successfully, but you have had to set that speed up two or three jumps previous, and often a few screen lengths away.  Also, you can't scroll the screen, so you can't look ahead.

Further still, the game is physics based, so your run is a little bit random each time as any slight variation (including random chance) modifies the position of your fluid, making some levels impossible on some runs.

To cap this trifecta of fail off, the whole time the game is making fun of you for your forced failure, calling you a 'whiner' for skipping levels that you get overly frustrated in because of aforementioned trial and error gameplay, laughing at your poor times and mocking your difficulty choice.

What would have been a neat physics game was outright ruined by terrible design practices.  90% of the game's issues could be fixed if the score system was published before a run, and if there was a map or scrolling overview of each run shown before you began.

Do not buy this game.  Do not let your friends buy this game.  Do not support this company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007899609', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1384779118}
review:
Jeu de plates-formes/réflexe très sympathique utilisant le moteur physique comme élément principal de gameplay. En effet, seules deux touches suffisent pour jouer : les touches directionnelles gauche et droite qui ''inclinent le monde'' afin de faire se déplacer divers liquides aux propriétés différentes que nous incarnons tout au long des 8 chapitres variés du jeu. Le but étant de terminer chaque niveau le plus rapidement possible en perdant le moins possible de liquide. La durée de vie du jeu se situe entre 5 et 8h, mais peut être doublée grâce au mode extrême proposé. Cependant la difficulté du titre aurait pu être mieux gérée par moment de façon plus crescendo ; certains des niveaux sont très difficiles et juste après vous aurez 3 voire 4 niveaux validés très facilement. Ce défaut reste anodin.

Pour résumer : concept original, gameplay simple et très plaisant.

Du bon !

author: {'steamid': '76561198030277114', 'num_games_owned': 1925, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1450111774}
review:
Puddle is a liquid physics platformer, for the better part of the game you control liquid which you much guide to the end of each level. Obstacles and hazards stand in your way, if you venture too close to these the liquid "protagonist" will diminish, lose too much mass and it's game over. It's a unique idea, at any rate I haven't heard of another liquid physics platformer out there. As you progress through the game you will encounter a lot of different mechanics as well as different liquids (which each have their own properties). I will say that I appreciate and applaud the many great ideas that the developers had for these different levels, and the overall variety from biome to biome (and sometimes even from level to level) was one of the most enjoyable aspects of this game.

Unfortunately, it is also one of the worst aspects of the game. While a lot of these levels were enjoyable to play, others however were downright frustrating and even counter-intuitive at times. I don't discredit the interesting ideas behind some of these problematic levels, but somewhere along the lines something didn't translate. If I didn't know any better, I feel like this might have been noticed during testing and Q&A, because one of the "features" of the game is the ability to skip levels by using the "Skip and Whine" feature. Sounds to me like somewhere along the lines the developers were aware of these frustrating and poorly design levels and rather than remove or improve, they decided to add a skip feature mocking who should so dare to dislike a level.

This is conjecture of course, what I can say that levels like the ones where your controls are reversed for the entire level ended up making me hate playing the game. It might be worth picking up in a bundle, especially if you are unlike me and don't mind using the "skip and whine" feature, just be warned that you can only "skip and whine" so many levels until you have to go back and beat some of them to skip more. At the end of the day, I was glad when I beat the game. Not because I was glad to beat it, but I was glad it was over. I will reiterate that there is a lot of great ideas in the game, plenty which work, but it's the bad ones that really put a stopper to the enjoyment and have ultimately led me to rate this down.

review:
Puddle is a nice physics-based game. Goal of the game is to get as much as possible of a liquid to the end of the levels by tilting the gameworld left and right. Sounds easy enough but can get tricky in some levels - most levels are rather short though, so the big amount of whining about the difficulty on the Steam forums really surprised me. Finishing the game on normal difficulty settings requires some trial & error but isn't that hard, however getting gold medals on all levels (by finishing them in a short time and without losing much liquid) is definately a big challenge for all completionists out there.
What makes the game really shine is how much effort the developers put into making every level unique and interesting although the player's basically pressing only two buttons over the course of the whole game. There are several liquids with different attributes and handling, most of them reacting differently to their environment (pesticide, acid, nitroglycerin, lava and more).Then there are some levels where the liquid is inside a container like a beaker or a snow globe, thus slightly changing the gameplay (there's also one level without a liquid at all which, incidentally, was the only one I didn't like).
Add to that the diverse and well designed levels themselves: from an obligatory sewers level over levels inside the human body to a zero-G level in space - the game does a very good job at keeping things interesting despite its simple concept.

review: Замечательная игра, балансирующая между жанрами логики и экшена. Конечно игра на любителя, но у неё есть всё, что нужно для маленького шедевра. Всего две кнопки управления и масса разнообразных физических задачек. Суть проста – нужно перегнать из пункта А в пункт Б жидкость или предмет, преодолевая различные препятствия, путем наклона экрана вправо или влево. В какой-то степени игра напомнила мне гоночный симулятор, только вместо машины – лужица (собственно так и переводится puddle)  жидкости). Благодаря продуманному до мелочей дизайну уровней, непохожим одна на другую локациям, разнородным жидкостям (вода, нитроглицерин, жидкий металл и т.п.), и самое главное, отличной физике этот 2-кнопочный игровой процесс просто завораживает. Нет, без шуток, эту игру надо вместо лабораторных по физике давать в классе 7 или 8 – было бы весело и наглядно … В графическом и звуковом оформлении всё безупречно – стильная красочная картинка, современная графика и спецэффекты, ненавязчивая приятная музыка и аутентичные фоновые звуки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987546047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1388532385}
review:
I can only really comment on Normal mode (where you get chocolate medals), so I may write another review when I go back and complete it on Extreme (the other difficulty option).

Most Indie physics puzzle games that I have played work on a rough set principle: press the directional keys to move something/someone towards a goal whilest avoiding the traps. Usually, this is done in 2D like the platformers of old. In this case, you use left and right to alter the tilt on the screen in a similar way to a wooden marble maze. This does mean Puddle doesn't slip away from the pack's mentality in this respect but that does not rain on this game's parade too much. The formula works and the tilting is efficently done getting a reasonable balance between too much tilt at once and not enough although it does air on the cautious side a bit but I think that better for it. I also like how it shows you how your score was calculated, making it simplier to improve to the next medal (Pass, Bronze, Silver and Gold). What really shines through though is the creativity. Every liquid you play as has unique properties that add to the challange and you play as a solid amount of liquids accross the 30 levels contained within (on Normal at least) in which at least every five levels you get a new liquid and/or location to challange you. In fact, it's normally more frequent than that. For this, Pubble should be commended as every enviroment and liquid tends to bring with it new challanges, especially in later stages. The way you get the new liquids can be interesting as well. The designs of the stages means that despite the lack of instructions you always know what you are doing. In fact, the lack of instructions makes it all the more challanging and rewarding. The stages are beautifully designed and full of atmospheric colour. The extreme contrasts really make the stage come to life without obscuring your view. Don't expect perfect graphics though. In the final aspect, length, If you started the game at 14:00, you could probably be done with Normal by the time you get to 23:59 so considering that there's another mode and the nice distraction of the Lab (which is nothing to sing about but it's there) where you can create miniture situations and pour liquids through them you're looking at a fair old game given the price you're paying for it.

All in all although nothing unique game play wise, it does a clean act creativity and the content contained within is delightful. A solid game. 8/10.

review:
I don't think many people will actually buy this because they're interested in it. It's just one of those games that doesn't draw much - if any - attention. 'Impulsive' is a word most of us will recognize here. Myself included. Before playing I had no idea what this game was all about. 'Why ?', I keep asking myself. Because this game is great fun.

Essentially Puddle is a platformer game where instead of a character you control multiple fluids (sticky, explosive, you name it). You know the drill; getting from point A to B. But there are switches to be flipped, fluids to be split and more, and you have to tactically move your fluid because if the fluid get below a certain amount it's game over. Some of the later levels can be truly frustrating, but at the same time fun and, in a way, relaxing.

It looks great in motion, I truly adore the artwork. It's simple, yet sophisticated and colorful. Just check out the screenshots and you know what I mean. The sound effects get the job done, in a realistic way. It's what you'd expect.

To all my fellow impulse-buyers; please do check out this game. You won't regret it, I'm pretty sure (that's right; not 100% :P).

review:
Funny game, a mix between Limbo and I-Fluid.

You are not controlling the liquids, you control the screen with the "left" and "right" keys.
You have to be careful with your liquid, do not lose to much of your puddle or it's Game Over.

While playing the story you play different liquids like water ofc, hydrocarbon, nitroglycerin and more funny and disgusting stuff. The levels artwork is awesome like the X-Ray photograph levels where you are inside a humans body or painted levels with almost the style of "Doodle Jump".

Some levels are not easy even if you already know what to do. Has a Normal Mode and a Hardcore Mode, in Normal you can often skip levels, in Hardcore you don't have that much skips and you can earn gold medals.

For arround 10€ it's worth to buy. 8/10
